body: Either we do it now, either we postpone it to `0.2.0` along with a deprecation, and remove the deprecation in `0.3.0`. Thoughts?

It should be noted that 1D used to be `order2=True`, as well. I changed it for the reasons you describe (more general, easier to add zeroth order, third order, and so on).

Not sure about `n_orders`. Note that current `max_order=2` corresponds to `n_orders=3` since we have orders zero, one, and two. On the other hand, I'm not fixated on `max_order` either.
I copied the order2 arg from 1d to 2d when adding this feature feel free to sync them

> Not sure about n_orders. Note that current max_order=2 corresponds to n_orders=3 since we have orders zero, one, and two.

Oh my, that's a very good point.

Come to think of it, I like `max_order` more than `n_orders`. Because the `orders` can be changed at runtime between `0` and `max_order-1`. Shall I make a PR?

> Come to think of it, I like `max_order` more than `n_orders`.

Ok great!

> Because the `orders` can be changed at runtime between `0` and `max_order-1`.

Am I missing something here or do you mean `orders` can contain values between `0` and `max_order`?

> Shall I make a PR?

Yes please!

> Am I missing something here or do you mean orders can contain values between 0 and max_order?

No, you're right. Anywhere between `0` and `max_order`. And it defaults to `range(0, 1+max_order)`. 
I got bitten by EWD 831 again
wait your telling me I can do Scattering2d(max_order=0)?  lol
@eugenium I mean, it's a pretty contrived way to compute a Gaussian blur, but who's to say that there will never be a use case for it? :p

> wait your telling me I can do Scattering2d(max_order=0)? lol

Why not? I think it works in `Scattering1D` already. Go ahead, try it for yourself!

issue.title: REF bool order2 -> int max_order in Scattering2D

repository.name: kymatio
repository.description: Wavelet scattering transforms in Python with GPU acceleration

issue.body:
a contribution to solving #196 in the case of 2D
more consistency between 1D and 2D
enabling the development of third-order scattering in the future

body:
Sorry I'm late to this discussion.
I would have weighed in for e.g. `orders=(0, 1, 2)` at construction.

The proposed solution is OK, though, and since there is an almost finished PR for it, we should move that direction.

@eickenberg the kwarg `orders` can be added later.
here we do not have one because we only officially support `orders=range(0, 1+max_order)`
but this kwarg is useful for:
* skipping the zeroth order (in audio for example)
* skipping the second order without having to construct a whole new operator

`max_order` would be stored as `_max_order` (pseudo-immutable) in the object
but
`orders` would be stored as `orders` because it is mutable (as any subset of `range(0, 1+max_order)`)

would you be OK with this agenda?

>  this kwarg

meaning `orders=` ?

> would you be OK with this agenda?

agenda == 1. add `max_order` now 2. add `orders` some time in the future?
then yes

yes, `this kwarg` is `orders` :) 
shall we rebase and merge #212 then?

Yes

On Thu, Nov 29, 2018, 2:08 PM Vincent Lostanlen <notifications@github.com
wrote:

> yes, this kwarg is orders :)
> shall we rebase and merge #212
> <https://github.com/kymatio/kymatio/pull/212> then?
>
> 
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/kymatio/kymatio/issues/196#issuecomment-443012002>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABPwC2lcJZxeJ9X-qSnqpnqGIDOUjAINks5u0FrsgaJpZM4YxqNa>
> .
>

@janden no, #212 was only for 2D. For 1D it's just a rename. For 3D it's a little bit more involved because at the moment the number of orders is a kwarg of `forward`. It should be made part of the constructor
